content.protection:
Aid rack- 1 set of nuts, double set of cams, many finger-sized pieces, and one #3 and #4 Camalot.

Free rack- less than above.

Bolt and tree anchor (

addendum: now 2 bolts

).
content.location: This is the finger crack just left of a clean corner.

content.description:
The direct start to

Space Boy

avoids the traverse in from the left and adds another hard crux. The first two bolts are on less-than-perfect rock (stick clip), but then it improves greatly. The low crux is roughly equal to the upper crux on

Space Boy

itself, but given the two no-hands rests it likely does not add to the grade.
content.location:
This is on the left hand side of the

Stargazer

area.

content.description:
This is the steep bolted route that climbs the face left of an arete to the left of

Stargazer Crack

.
content.location:
This is on the left hand side of the

Stargazer

area.

content.description: Start on Space Boy Elroy's original start, clip 4 bolts and veer left.  3 more bolts take you to a ledge.  Probably 5.11b to this point.  Follow the bolts up along the arete to a rest right before the crux. Power though the last few moves to the anchor.
content.protection: 13-14 draws. The anchor has chain and steel biners on it.
content.location:
Rosie starts on

Space Boy Elroy's

original start then veers left to the left arete.

content.description: Scramble up 8’ to a bushy ledge where the route actually starts. Off the ledge the gear is thin, but the climbing isn’t heinous. After a few feet, you start hitting good gear. Follow the crack up to the right of the tree. Place some good gear in the discontinuous cracks. At this point, the crack has ended, and you’re face climbing. Clip two bolts as you tip toe up the delicate slab finish. Try to clip the anchors proudly, but if you’re like me, you’ll likely be grabbing them. The anchor is two bolts with chain and Mussy hooks.
content.protection: Stoppers and cams to a #3 Camalot.
content.location:
Golden Dragon is just after you drop down off the obvious hill just past

Rosie

and

Space Boy Elroy

. Look up through the scrub oak, and you’ll see a cool, little dihedral.

content.description: Beware of the death block; don't kill your belayer.
content.location:
This is before

Stargazer

finger crack.

content.description: Ascend the wide crack up a left-facing corner.  It doesn't get done very much and tends to be dirty.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Stargazer

.
